Adu Ketangkasan! Lomba Parut Kelapa Tercepat Ini Jadi Hiburan di Thailand
03 Nov 2019, 03:00 by Sonia Basoni - detikFood


Foto: Istimewa

Jakarta - Banyak lomba seru dan unik di Thailand. Salah satunya lomba memarut kelapa dengan waktu tercepat, yang jadi hiburan lokal di Thailand.Tak hanya di kota besar, banyak wilayah desa di Thailand yang punya acara unik dan menarik perhatian banyak orang. Salah satunya ada kompetisi parut kelapa tercepat, yang diselenggarakan oleh warga di desa Trang, Thailand Selatan (30/10).Baca Juga: Selain untuk Memarut Keju, Parutan Ini Juga Bisa untuk Memarut Bahan Ini


Foto: Istimewa

Lomba parut kelapa ini sudah jadi acara rutin setiap tahunnya, dan juga sudah menjadi hiburan bagi warga setempat.Lewat video berdurasi sekitar satu menit lebih, keseruan lomba parut kelapa tahun ini jadi viral di sosial media. Video dibuka dengan beberapa warga, yang duduk rapi di depan wadah, dan parutan kelapa tradisional.Setelah itu, mereka mulai adu ketangkasan, memarut kelapa dengan jumlah terbanyak dan dalam waktu singkat. Keseruan dimulai, ketika semua orang yang mengikuti lomba ini sudah ahli memarut kelapa.


Foto: Istimewa

Acara lomba memarut kelapa ini diadakan sebagai ajang menggalang dana, untuk festival Buddist Boat yang akan dilangsungkan tahun depan. Meski tujuannya untuk amal, juara yang mampu memarut kelapa terbanyak ini, mendapatkan hadiah uang tunai 2,000 baht (Rp 930,775).Meski hadiahnya tak seberapa, tapi para peserta antusias mengikutinya. Bahkan lomba parut kelapa ini ditonton banyak orang, dan jadi hiburan tersendiri bagi warga lokal.Lomba ini dimenangkan oleh warga bernama Ngeg Wanraek, yang sudah berusia 78 tahun. Ngeg sendiri merupakan juara bertahan selama 12 tahun, karena dia selalu berhasil memarut kelapa utuh dalam waktu tiga menit.Ngeg yang selalu mengikuti kompetisi ini setiap tahunnya, mengatakan bahwa dia ingin peserta baru untuk ikut lomba ini. Selain menjadi tantangan untuknya, ia juga ingin banyak orang menyumbang acara amal ini.


Foto: Istimewa

"Kompetisi memarut kelapa ini sangat menyenangkan. Bukan karena saya selalu menang, tapi karena kita bisa berkumpul bersama menggalang dana untuk festival Bhuddist Boat tahun depan," pungkas Ngeg.Sementara para netizen memuji aksi para warga Trang, yang masih mempertahankan budaya lokal untuk menggalang dana."Sekarang, banyak orang yang tidak tahu caranya memarut kelapa. Tapi lewat kompetisi ini, generasi muda bisa lebih mengenal budaya memarut kelapa yang terkenal di Asia," puji salah satu netizen.Baca Juga: Nanas untuk Selai, Sebaiknya Diparut atau Diblender?

Agility Fighting! The Fastest Grated Coconut Race Becomes Entertainment in Thailand
03 Nov 2019, 03:00 by Sonia Basoni - detikFood


Photo: Special

Jakarta - Many exciting and unique competitions in Thailand. One of them is the race to grate coconut with the fastest time, which became local entertainment in Thailand. Not only in big cities, many rural areas in Thailand have unique events and attract the attention of many people. One of them is the fastest coconut grated competition, which is held by residents in the village of Trang, Southern Thailand (30/10). Also Read: In addition to Grate Cheese, This Grater Can Also Grate This Material


Photo: Special

This coconut grated competition has become a regular event every year, and also has become entertainment for local residents. Through a video that lasts about one minute more, the excitement of this year's coconut grate contest has become viral on social media. The video opens with a number of residents, who sit neatly in front of the container, and grated traditional coconut. After that, they start fighting agility, grating the most coconut and in a short amount of time. The excitement began, when everyone who participated in this competition was expert at grate the coconut.


Photo: Special

The event to grate the coconut is held as a fundraising event, for the Buddist Boat festival which will be held next year. Although the goal is for charity, the champion who is able to grate the most coconut, gets a cash prize of 2,000 baht (Rp. 930,775). Even though the prize is not much, the participants are enthusiastic to follow it. Even the coconut grated competition was watched by many people, and became its own entertainment for local residents. The competition was won by a resident named Ngeg Wanraek, who was 78 years old. Ngeg himself was a defending champion for 12 years, because he always managed to grate whole coconuts in three minutes. The State Minister, who always participates in this competition every year, said that he wanted new participants to take part in this competition. Besides being a challenge for him, he also wants many people to contribute to this charity event.


Photo: Special

"The coconut grating competition is very fun. Not because I always win, but because we can gather together to raise funds for the Bhuddist Boat festival next year," concluded Ngeg. While netizens praised the actions of the Trang residents, who still maintain local culture to raise funds "Now, many people do not know how to grate coconut. But through this competition, the younger generation can get to know the culture of grating coconut which is famous in Asia," said one netizen.
